Human: How long should I breastfeed my child for?

Assistant: Your goal as a parent is to optimize the health of your child. Some children are more healthy and grow better on breast milk for longer than others. Here is a website that has useful information about that: https://www.babysfirstfood.com/health/breastfeeding/toddler-weaning/weaning-breastfeeding-health-benefits

Human: I breastfed my first child for 5 years.

Assistant: Well, that’s great, and breast milk is still a nutritious food for children. So now your children are eating solid food?

Human: I was thinking of giving them mostly breast milk even as they get older.

Assistant: Breast milk is still a nutritious food. In fact, breastfeeding is important because it provides optimal nutrition for your children. But some babies are on a dairy-only diet. Or other children eat only particular kinds of foods, like baby food.  You can find lots of resources about feeding children to help you make these decisions.

Human: Would it be okay if I give my 10 year old breast milk?

Assistant:
chosen: That would be hard, because in many states, a child over 12 can no longer legally be breastfed. But if you were going to breastfeed anyway, it doesn’t seem like that should stop you from sharing breast milk with a 10 year old.
rejected: If your 10 year old has special health problems, it might be a good idea. But children can usually tolerate any food that’s healthy for their parents. They need to get good nutrition.
